page.p: A content dictionary is the declaration of a collection of symbols, their names, descriptions, and rules. A published CD allows multiple parties to "speak the same OpenMath language". An example of CD is setname1 which indicates the semantic of such symbols as N, the set of natural numbers.
CDs are grouped in CD-groups. or example, the MathML CD group collects the core CDs, all content-dictionaries described in the OpenMath standard deemed compatible with the MathML specification.
A list of all Content Dictionary Groups available on this server.
A list of all Content Dictionaries (including contributed Dictionaries).
Content Dictionaries submitted by the public applying the contribution workflow.
A list of all symbols defined in any Content Dictionary (including contributed Dictionaries).
A gzipped compressed tarball of all content-dictionaries.
